**Monkey D.** "**Straw Hat** "[n 1] **Luffy**[n 2]
([Japanese](/wiki/Japanese_language "Japanese language"): モンキー・D・ルフィ,
[Hepburn](/wiki/Hepburn_romanization "Hepburn romanization"): _Monkī Dī Rufi_)
is a [fictional character](/wiki/Character_\(arts\) "Character \(arts\)") and
the main [protagonist](/wiki/Protagonist "Protagonist") of the _[One
Piece](/wiki/One_Piece "One Piece")_ manga series, created by [Eiichiro
Oda](/wiki/Eiichiro_Oda "Eiichiro Oda"). Luffy made his debut in _One Piece_
chapter #1 as a young boy who acquires the properties of rubber after
inadvertently eating the supernatural Gum-Gum fruit.

He sails from the East Blue Sea to the Grand Line in search of the legendary
treasure, One Piece, to succeed Gol D. Roger as King of the Pirates. Luffy,
captain of the [Straw Hat Pirates](/wiki/Straw_Hat_Pirates "Straw Hat
Pirates"), recruits crew members, fights antagonists, and aids and befriends
the inhabitants of several islands during his journey. Usually cheerful, he
becomes serious when he fights. Luffy uses his elasticity to concentrate his
power, executing a range of attacks. In his signature attack, Gum-Gum Pistol,
he slingshots punches at opponents from a distance.

Luffy appears in most of the episodes, films, television specials, and
[OVAs](/wiki/Original_video_animation "Original video animation") of the
manga's anime adaptations and several of the franchise's [video
games](/wiki/Video_game "Video game"). Due to the series' international
popularity, Luffy has become one of the world's most recognizable anime
characters. In addition to the _One Piece_ franchise, the character has
appeared in a number of manga and anime series and collaborative video games.
His critical reception has been largely positive.

## Creation and
conception[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Monkey_D._Luffy&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Creation and conception")]

###
Development[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Monkey_D._Luffy&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Development")]

When [Eiichiro Oda](/wiki/Eiichiro_Oda "Eiichiro Oda") created Luffy, he
strove for a "manliness" similar to that of [Akira
Toriyama](/wiki/Akira_Toriyama "Akira Toriyama")'s _[Dragon
Ball](/wiki/Dragon_Ball "Dragon Ball")_ series.[1] Oda said that he named his
main character "Luffy" because he felt that the name suited him. When he later
learned about the sailing term, "[luffing](/wiki/Luffing "Luffing")", he was
delighted by the coincidence.[2] In his prototype one-shots, "Romance Dawn",
Oda refined the artistic style and story elements before publishing the final
product a year later as the first chapter of _One Piece_. In the second
version of "Romance Dawn", Luffy resembled his design at the beginning of the
series.[3] To please his readers, Oda added rubberization to Luffy for comic
effect[2] and tries to make the character straightforward.[4]

### Voice
actors[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Monkey_D._Luffy&action=edit&section=3 "Edit
section: Voice actors")]

[![Young, dark-haired voice actress Colleen
Clinkenbeard](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/84/ColleenClinkenbeardHeadshot.jpg/220px-
ColleenClinkenbeardHeadshot.jpg)](/wiki/File:ColleenClinkenbeardHeadshot.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:ColleenClinkenbeardHeadshot.jpg "Enlarge")

Colleen Clinkenbeard voiced Luffy in English.

In the original Japanese version of the _One Piece_ anime series and later
spin-offs of the franchise, Luffy was voiced by [Mayumi
Tanaka](/wiki/Mayumi_Tanaka "Mayumi Tanaka").[5] Tanaka said jokingly that she
regrets providing Luffy's voice because she is a mother in real life and Luffy
is much younger.[6] Asked about her voicing, Tanaka said that she "strives for
reality" in scenes where Luffy speaks when he is eating or touching his
nose.[7] In the OVA _Defeat the Pirate Ganzack!_ , Luffy was voiced by [Urara
Takano](/wiki/Urara_Takano "Urara Takano").[8] The character was voiced by
[Colleen Clinkenbeard](/wiki/Colleen_Clinkenbeard "Colleen Clinkenbeard") in
[Funimation](/wiki/Funimation "Funimation")'s English-language dub of the _One
Piece_ franchise.[9]

## Description[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Monkey_D._Luffy&action=edit&section=4
"Edit section: Description")]

Luffy is usually recognizable by his [straw hat](/wiki/Straw_hat "Straw hat"),
a gift from ["Red-Haired" Shanks](/wiki/List_of_One_Piece_characters#Shanks
"List of One Piece characters"). In his early childhood, he wears a white
shirt and blue shorts. The character has a scar under his left eye from
stabbing himself to demonstrate his courage to Shanks and his crew.[10] He
later wears a red vest, [denim](/wiki/Denim "Denim") shorts and sandals before
replacing his vest with a red, unbuttoned sea captain's coat[11] (revealing
the X-shaped scar on his chest he received from Akainu),[12] and a yellow sash
tied around his waist.[11]

###
Personality[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Monkey_D._Luffy&action=edit&section=5
"Edit section: Personality")]

Luffy is portrayed as a carefree, happy-go-lucky character with great ambition
and a huge appetite, often thinking with his stomach and comically gorging
himself. Caring and generally good-hearted, he is not as dimwitted as many
believe him to be and often demonstrates more understanding than the other
characters expect. Knowing the danger ahead, Luffy is willing to risk his life
to become King of the Pirates and protect his crew. A capable and reliable
captain, he never puts his crew or himself at risk out of incompetence. During
the Loguetown story arc, Smoker (a navy captain at the time) says that Luffy
"enjoys playing stupid"; Luffy responds with a mysterious smile.

He enlists Chopper and Brook for his crew for their personality or appearance,
but also because of his instinctive ability to read people. Luffy needs key
jobs filled by his crew (cook, navigator, doctor, musician and shipwright,
filled by Sanji, Nami, Chopper, Brook and Franky respectively). At the
beginning of the series, he said that he wanted at least 10 crew members with
abilities he felt necessary for his goal. Despite his carefree personality,
each crew member respects him in their own way.[13][14] Luffy is rarely
concerned about the consequences of his actions, doing what he feels is best
even if it leads to retaliation by a powerful force.[15] He is an extremely
loyal captain, who has demonstrated throughout the series that he is willing
to risk his life for the well-being of his crew.[16]

### Abilities[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Monkey_D._Luffy&action=edit&section=6
"Edit section: Abilities")]

Luffy's rubberiness is a result of eating the Gum-Gum fruit,[n 3][17] which
makes him immune to most blunt forces and electric attacks and gives him the
ability to stretch his body at will. He uses his elasticity to accelerate part
or all of his body to deliver punches, kicks, head butts and body checks or
for propulsion. Like others exposed to Devil Fruit, Luffy cannot swim; when he
is submerged in water or contacts the Sea-Prism Stone, he loses his strength
and cannot move on his own. In addition to his Devil Fruit powers, he has
immense strength and endurance.

Luffy's signature attack is the Gum-Gum Pistol, a punch which he learned
during years of training. Another technique developed later in the series is
Second Gear (ギア2 (セカンド), _Gia Sekando_), increasing his strength and speed for
a short time but straining his body. Observing
[CP9's](/wiki/List_of_One_Piece_characters#CP9 "List of One Piece characters")
Shave (剃, _Soru_) technique, Luffy adapted the move to his rubber body and
matched the assassins' speed. Third Gear (ギア3 (サード), _Gia Sādo_), another
technique, uses air in his bones to attack but makes him shrink
afterwards.[18] Luffy can use both techniques simultaneously; after two years,
he has gained better control of the techniques and is no longer affected by
their drawbacks.

Eventually, Luffy develops his latent ability to use Haki (覇気, ambition). This
ability has two main types: Armament Haki (武装色の覇気, _Busōshoku no Haki_), an
armor-like force which can amplify defense and the force of attacks and negate
a Devil Fruit user's defense, allow physical contact and damage, and
Observation Haki (見聞色の覇気, _Kenbunshoku no Haki_), a sixth sense which can read
a person's moves and detect their presence. He also has a rare third type, the
Conquering King's Haki (覇王色の覇気, _Haōshoku no Haki_), which can render people
or animals near him unconscious.[19] Two years later, Luffy masters the three
types of Haki and uses them with his improved attacks. As a result of his
encounter with [Magellan](/wiki/List_of_One_Piece_characters#Impel_Down "List
of One Piece characters"), he has also developed an immunity to poison
(although it is implied that a strong poison may affect him).

Luffy develops another technique, Fourth Gear (ギア4 (フォース), _Gia Fōsu_)
(similar to Third Gear), inflating his muscles to increase the size of his
limbs (except for his legs). He can make destructive moves by compressing and
releasing his limbs, and can fly in a similar fashion to CP9's Moon Walk (月歩,
_Geppō_) technique.[20]

## Appearances[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Monkey_D._Luffy&action=edit&section=7
"Edit section: Appearances")]

### _One
Piece_[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Monkey_D._Luffy&action=edit&section=8 "Edit
section: One Piece")]

Luffy first appears as a young boy in Windmill Village, who befriends the
pirate ["Red-Haired"](/wiki/List_of_One_Piece_characters#Shanks "List of One
Piece characters") Shanks and intends to become one himself. Before the series
begins, he accidentally eats the Gum-Gum fruit and acquires rubber powers.
Luffy is later saved by Shanks from being devoured by a Sea King, a large sea
beast, and Shanks loses an arm. Ten years later, Luffy leaves the village in
search of the One Piece treasure and to become King of the Pirates. He meets
swordsman [Roronoa Zoro](/wiki/Roronoa_Zoro "Roronoa Zoro"), ocean
[navigator](/wiki/Navigator "Navigator") and thief
[Nami](/wiki/Nami_\(One_Piece\) "Nami \(One Piece\)"), cowardly marksman and
liar [Usopp](/wiki/List_of_One_Piece_characters#Usopp "List of One Piece
characters"), and chivalrous chef
[Sanji](/wiki/List_of_One_Piece_characters#Sanji "List of One Piece
characters"), and invites them to join his crew. Luffy also encounters and
defeats the East Blue pirate [Buggy the
Clown](/wiki/List_of_One_Piece_characters#Buggy "List of One Piece
characters") and the fishman
[Arlong](/wiki/List_of_One_Piece_characters#Arlong "List of One Piece
characters"), becoming known to the general populace and the pirate-hating
Marines. He later accepts an offer to return Princess Nefertari Vivi of
Alabasta to her homeland to stop a rebellion incited by [Seven Warlords of the
Sea](/wiki/Seven_Warlords_of_the_Sea "Seven Warlords of the Sea") member and
Baroque Works crime-syndicate leader [Sir
Crocodile](/wiki/List_of_One_Piece_characters#Crocodile "List of One Piece
characters"). After he defeats Crocodile, Luffy accepts Crocodile subordinate
[Nico Robin](/wiki/List_of_One_Piece_characters#Nico_Robin "List of One Piece
characters") as his ally. On Drum Island he finds reindeer doctor [Tony Tony
Chopper](/wiki/List_of_One_Piece_characters#Tony_Tony_Chopper "List of One
Piece characters"), who also joins his crew.

While visiting Skypiea, the crew is drawn into a war. Luffy defeats the god
[Eneru](/wiki/List_of_One_Piece_characters#Eneru "List of One Piece
characters"), ending the war. He meets Admiral
[Aokiji](/wiki/List_of_One_Piece_characters#Aokiji "List of One Piece
characters"), who easily defeats him. Luffy learns about Robin's background
and faces enemies connected to her, such as
[Franky](/wiki/List_of_One_Piece_characters#Franky "List of One Piece
characters") (a cyborg who becomes Luffy's ally) and the intelligence agency
[Cipher Pol No. 9](/wiki/List_of_One_Piece_characters#Cipher_Pol_No._9 "List
of One Piece characters"). Luffy and his crew save Robin at Enies Lobby. After
their fight with CP9, Franky joins the crew. Luffy enters the Florian Triangle
and encounters [Brook](/wiki/List_of_One_Piece_characters#Brook "List of One
Piece characters"), a skeletal musician. To return Brook's shadow, he defeats
warlord [Gecko Moria](/wiki/List_of_One_Piece_characters#Gecko_Moria "List of
One Piece characters"). After releasing the rest of the island's prisoners,
Brook becomes a member of Luffy's crew. They go to the Sabaody Archipelago,
and have [Silvers
Rayleigh](/wiki/List_of_One_Piece_characters#Silvers_Rayleigh "List of One
Piece characters") coat the _Thousand Sunny_ to enter the second half of the
Grand Line. After Luffy's encounter with Admiral
[Kizaru](/wiki/List_of_One_Piece_characters#Kizaru "List of One Piece
characters") and warlord [Bartholomew
Kuma](/wiki/List_of_One_Piece_characters#Bartholomew_Kuma "List of One Piece
characters"), he and his crew are sent to separate parts of the world.

Stranded on Amazon Lily, an island ruled by the warlord Boa Hancock, Luffy
impresses Hancock with his bravery and selflessness. Hancock falls in love
with Luffy and brings him to the underground Impel Down prison to save his
brother, Portgas D. Ace, from execution. Luffy breaks into the prison and
meets previous foes and new allies, such as former warlord
[Jimbei](/wiki/List_of_One_Piece_characters#Jimbei "List of One Piece
characters"). He frees the prisoners, they arrive at Marineford and Luffy is
drawn into a war between the navy and Whitebeard's pirate crews. Ace gives his
life to save Luffy, who is evacuated with Jimbei from Marineford by Trafalgar
Law. Returning to Amazon Lily, Luffy remembers first meeting Ace; after Shanks
left Windmill Village, Luffy's grandfather left him in the care of bandit
Curly Dadan. He befriends Ace and Sabo, who are like brothers to him, but Sabo
is apparently killed by a World Noble. After returning to Marineford to send a
hidden message to his crew, Luffy trains with Rayleigh on Ruskaina Island to
become stronger.

Two years later Luffy rejoins the Straw Hats, but the crew is briefly
separated again while sailing to Fishman Island. Luffy and the others meet
Jimbei and the island's princess, Shirahoshi, and are drawn into a battle for
the island against fishman Hody Jones. He, the crew and Jimbei conceive of a
plan to defeat Hody and his henchmen. After Hody's defeat, Luffy retrieves the
stolen treasure from the rookie pirate Caribou and begins a feud with Big Mom.
The crew enters the New World; Luffy, Zoro, Usopp and Robin disembark on Punk
Hazard and are soon captured by Caesar Clown, a jealous rival of the scientist
Vegapunk. Luffy and his crew ally with Trafalgar Law, and he defeats Caesar
after learning about his history. With Caesar hostage the alliance lands on
Dressrosa (the kingdom of Don Quixote Doflamingo), where Luffy enters a
tournament to win Ace's Devil Fruit.

### In other
media[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Monkey_D._Luffy&action=edit&section=9 "Edit
section: In other media")]

Luffy has appeared in every _One Piece_ licensed electronic video game to
date, including _[Jump Super Stars](/wiki/Jump_Super_Stars "Jump Super
Stars")_ and _[Jump Ultimate Stars](/wiki/Jump_Ultimate_Stars "Jump Ultimate
Stars")_ , and is featured in the 2006 _[Dragon Ball Z](/wiki/Dragon_Ball_Z
"Dragon Ball Z")_ -_One Piece_ -_[Naruto](/wiki/Naruto "Naruto")_ crossover
game _[Battle Stadium D.O.N](/wiki/Battle_Stadium_D.O.N "Battle Stadium
D.O.N")_. Luffy, Son Goku and [Naruto Uzumaki](/wiki/Naruto_Uzumaki "Naruto
Uzumaki") were avatars in the
[MMORPG](/wiki/Massively_multiplayer_online_role-playing_game "Massively
multiplayer online role-playing game") _[Second Life](/wiki/Second_Life
"Second Life")_ for a [Jump Festa](/wiki/Jump_Festa "Jump Festa") promotion,
"Jumpland@Second Life".[21] Luffy has also been mentioned in songs. He sings
about being a wanted pirate in "Wanted!"[22] and about _One Piece_ in "Every-
One Peace!"[23] Luffy is a major playable character in the crossover game,
_[J-Stars Victory VS](/wiki/J-Stars_Victory_VS "J-Stars Victory VS")_.[24]

The character has made guest appearances in Japanese television shows and
manga. Luffy and several other characters joined the cast of _Dragon Ball_ in
a spinoff entitled _Cross Epoch_.[25] On April 3, 2011, Luffy and the other
_One Piece_ protagonists appeared in the first episode of the
_[Toriko](/wiki/Toriko "Toriko")_ anime series and the crossover manga
chapter.[26] Luffy made a cameo appearance in a _Weekly Shonen Jump_ episode
of _[To Love-Ru](/wiki/To_Love-Ru "To Love-Ru")_ , and the Gum-Gum was
mentioned in the 50th episode of the _[Gin Tama](/wiki/Gin_Tama "Gin Tama")_
anime series.[27] He has also appeared in the [web comic](/wiki/Web_comic "Web
comic"), _[VG Cats](/wiki/VG_Cats "VG Cats")_.[28] In 2008, [Toei
Animation](/wiki/Toei_Animation "Toei Animation") sponsored the
[Italian](/wiki/Italy "Italy") [Pallavolo Modena](/wiki/Pallavolo_Modena
"Pallavolo Modena") [volleyball](/wiki/Volleyball "Volleyball") team; Pietro
Rinaldi and Edoardo Ciabattini's black uniforms were decorated with an image
of Luffy on the front.[29] Luffy appeared on the cover of the January 2010
issue of the Japanese fashion magazine _Men 's Non-No_, the first manga
character to do so. His clothes were designed by Shinichi "Miter" Mita.[30]

## Reception[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Monkey_D._Luffy&action=edit&section=10
"Edit section: Reception")]

Luffy led all three _Shōnen Jump_ character popularity polls.[31][32][33]
According to [Funimation Entertainment](/wiki/Funimation_Entertainment
"Funimation Entertainment")'s [Mike McFarland](/wiki/Mike_McFarland "Mike
McFarland") and [Christopher Sabat](/wiki/Christopher_Sabat "Christopher
Sabat"), Luffy was more likable than _Dragon Ball_ 's [Son
Goku](/wiki/Son_Goku_\(Dragon_Ball\) "Son Goku \(Dragon Ball\)").[34] Joe
McCulloch preferred Luffy to [Naruto Uzumaki](/wiki/Naruto_Uzumaki "Naruto
Uzumaki") from _[Naruto](/wiki/Naruto "Naruto")_ because Luffy "work[ed] his
ass off" to achieve his goals after accidentally acquiring his powers.[35]
Luffy was nominated in the Best Male Character category for the 2008 Society
for the Promotion of Japanese Animation Awards, losing to [Ichigo
Kurosaki](/wiki/Ichigo_Kurosaki "Ichigo Kurosaki") of
_[Bleach](/wiki/Bleach_\(manga\) "Bleach \(manga\)")_.[36][37] He was ranked
22nd on Chris Mackenzie's IGN list of top-25 anime characters of all time.[38]
[NTT](/wiki/NTT "NTT") customers chose Luffy as their second-favorite black-
haired male anime character.[39] The Gum-Gum Gatling technique topped the male
category in a Japanese survey of the most popular moves in manga and
anime.[40] In a Japanese TV special from August 2017, Luffy was voted as the
8th "strongest hero" from the [Showa Era](/wiki/Showa_Era "Showa Era") as well
as the 4th one from the [Heisei Era](/wiki/Heisei_Era "Heisei Era").[41]

Luffy has been praised in a number of publications. T.H.E.M. Anime Reviews
called Luffy "likabl[y] goofy" and an idealist with infectious optimism.[42]
In a review of _[One Piece The Movie: Dead End no
Bōken](/wiki/One_Piece_The_Movie:_Dead_End_no_B%C5%8Dken "One Piece The Movie:
Dead End no Bōken")_ , the fourth _One Piece_ film, _[The Star
Online](/wiki/The_Star_\(Malaysia\) "The Star \(Malaysia\)")_ described him as
"an airhead and brilliant fighter".[43] Rika Takahashi of [EX](/wiki/TV_Asahi
"TV Asahi") wrote that Luffy's stretching powers set _One Piece_ apart from
"the old stereotypical adventure manga" and the many other "combat-oriented
mangas [_[sic](/wiki/Sic "Sic")_]", making the series "something new and
interesting".[44] [Anime News Network](/wiki/Anime_News_Network "Anime News
Network") (ANN) writer Zac Bertschy found Luffy reminiscent of _[Rurouni
Kenshin](/wiki/Rurouni_Kenshin "Rurouni Kenshin")_ 's character [Himura
Kenshin](/wiki/Himura_Kenshin "Himura Kenshin") in personality and attitude,
but still thought him entertaining.[45] Mania Entertainment's Bryce Coulter
called Luffy a "great shonen hero".[46] ANN's Carl Kimlinger wrote, "[Colleen
Clinkenbeard](/wiki/Colleen_Clinkenbeard "Colleen Clinkenbeard")'s Luffy
continues to grow on you".[47] In the final chapter of _Naruto_ , [Boruto
Uzumaki](/wiki/Boruto_Uzumaki "Boruto Uzumaki") makes a drawing of Luffy as a
legacy of him and the series.[48]

In a _Weekly Shonen Jump_ manga, Tsugihagi Hyouryuu Sakka (a character
resembling Luffy) says, "Instead of saying what you hate, say what you like!"
In the _One Piece_ manga, Luffy cited but changed it to "Instead of saying
what you like, say what you hate!" The meme was acknowledged in the crossover
[fighting game](/wiki/Fighting_game "Fighting game"), _[J-Stars Victory
VS](/wiki/J-Stars_Victory_VS "J-Stars Victory VS")_[49]

"Edit section: Notes")]

  3. **Jump up ^** The Devil Fruit that Luffy gained his abilities from was originally called the Gomu no Mi (ゴムの実, lit. fruit of rubber), but after the editor pointed out that a real [rubber fruit](/wiki/Para_rubber_tree "Para rubber tree") existed, the name was changed to the Gomu Gomu no Mi (ゴムゴムの実, lit. fruit of rubber rubber, renamed "Gum Gum Fruit" in the English adaptations). (["Interview with Eiichiro Oda"](https://web.archive.org/web/20080204191903/http://manganohi.jp/2007/12/9419.html) (in Japanese). manganohi.jp.
